meanings.definition: Skillful use of one's hands when performing magic tricks.
meanings.sent1: The magician's legerdemain amazed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of legerdemain to entertain children at birthday parties.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to use legerdemain to juggle invisible balls, but everyone saw through his act.
meanings.sent4: His legerdemain with cards was so smooth, it seemed like the cards were dancing in his hands.
meanings.sent5: The master's legerdemain made it seem like objects were vanishing into thin air.

meanings.definition: Deception or trickery, especially involving sleight of hand.
meanings.sent1: The thief's legerdemain allowed him to pickpocket without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his legerdemain and caught him trying to cheat at cards.
meanings.sent3: The salesman's legerdemain with words convinced customers to buy products they didn't need.
meanings.sent4: His legerdemain in negotiations made it seem like he was giving more than he actually was.
meanings.sent5: The politician's legerdemain with promises fooled many into voting for him.

meanings.definition: Clever manipulation or trickery to achieve a desired result.
meanings.sent1: The student used legerdemain to make it seem like he had studied all night for the test.
meanings.sent2: Her legerdemain in getting out of trouble always left her classmates in awe.
meanings.sent3: The chef's legerdemain in the kitchen made it seem like he could turn any ingredient into a gourmet dish.
meanings.sent4: His legerdemain in solving problems made him the go-to person in the office.
meanings.sent5: The coach's legerdemain in motivating the team led them to victory against all odds.
